plugins.name: Diopter
plugins.description:
This plugin helps you see how you are using remote components for linked and unlinked libraries. For example, you can find mobile components in a file with only desktop explorations. With a tool like this, you can being spring cleaning now and get your files squeaky clean.


To use this plugin, you'll need to create a personal access token with read-only access to files. I needed that token to be able to get details about file libraries—e.g., library name. The first time you run the plugin, you'll be asked to paste the token.
plugins.tagline: Clearly see which components you're using and where they come from.

127509.name: Diopter
127509.description:

To use this plugin, you'll need to create a personal access token with read-only access to files. I needed that token to be able to get details about file libraries—e.g., library name. The first time you run the plugin, you'll be asked to paste the token.
127509.release_notes: Adds a way to find frames that used to be components.
127509.tagline: Clearly see which components you're using and where they come from.

plugins.name: Scribe Guard - AI-powered Writing System Validator
plugins.description:
🎯 What is it?

A powerful AI tool that analyzes your text content against your writing system guidelines, ensuring perfect brand consistency and tone of voice alignment.


✨ Key Features

  1. AI-powered content analysis
  2. Writing system validation
  3. Style guide compliance checks
  4. Tone of voice verification
  5. Terminology consistency
  6. Real-time feedback


🚀 How to Use

  1. Upload your Writing System PDF
  2. Enter your ChatGPT API key
  3. Click "Analyze Copy"
  4. Review the detailed analysis


🛠️ What You'll Need

  1. ChatGPT API key
  2. Your writing system guidelines in PDF


🔒 Security Note

Your API key is handled securely and can be saved locally for convenience. All communications are encrypted and only happen through authorized channels.



The tool provides detailed feedback on tone, terminology, and style compliance, helping you maintain perfect brand consistency across all your content. No more manual checking - let AI do the heavy lifting! ✨
plugins.tagline: Validate your text content against writing system guidelines with AI-powered analysis

plugins.name: Figmata
plugins.description: Figmata is a tool that brings data visualization into the Figma environment, letting designers map data directly onto design elements with live, visual feedback. Unlike rigid chart tools like Excel or Illustrator, Figmata enables custom, flexible, and interactive graphics—integrated into the design systems designers already use. It lowers the barrier to entry compared to D3 by working within Figma's component-based structure and offering code autocompletion for advanced users. Figmata supports CSV/JSON input, direct manipulation of visual properties, and saves state for iterative work. It bridges the gap between data and UI design, making data-rich interfaces more intuitive and design-friendly.
plugins.tagline: Data-driven design directly in Figma

130087.name: Figmata
130087.description: Figmata is a tool that brings data visualization into the Figma environment, letting designers map data directly onto design elements with live, visual feedback. Unlike rigid chart tools like Excel or Illustrator, Figmata enables custom, flexible, and interactive graphics—integrated into the design systems designers already use. It lowers the barrier to entry compared to D3 by working within Figma's component-based structure and offering code autocompletion for advanced users. Figmata supports CSV/JSON input, direct manipulation of visual properties, and saves state for iterative work. It bridges the gap between data and UI design, making data-rich interfaces more intuitive and design-friendly.

plugins.name: Template Manager
plugins.description:
Figma Template Saver


Description:

Effortlessly save and reuse entire Figma designs as templates while preserving frames, text, vectors, components, and precise positioning. This plugin ensures that every detail—fills, strokes, corner radius, and vector data—is accurately stored and replicated when applied to new files.


🔹 **Save any selection as a reusable template**

🔹 **Apply templates across different files with full fidelity**

🔹 **Preserve component instances, nested frames, vectors, and typography**

🔹 **Avoid missing fills or strokes with advanced capture logic**


Streamline your workflow and bring consistency to your designs—save once, apply anywhere! 🚀
plugins.tagline: **"Effortlessly save, reuse, and replicate Figma designs—preserve every detail with precision."**

117966.description:

Effortlessly save and reuse entire Figma designs as templates while preserving frames, text, vectors, components, and precise positioning. This plugin ensures that every detail—fills, strokes, corner radius, and vector data—is accurately stored and replicated when applied to new files.

🔹 **Apply templates across different files with full fidelity**

🔹 **Preserve component instances, nested frames, vectors, and typography**

🔹 **Avoid missing fills or strokes with advanced capture logic**


Streamline your workflow and bring consistency to your designs—save once, apply anywhere! 🚀
117966.tagline: **"Effortlessly save, reuse, and replicate Figma designs—preserve every detail with precision."**

plugins.name: K Translation
plugins.description:
K Translation is a localization tool designed to simplify the process of translating your Figma frames into multiple languages using XLIFF files.


After installing the plugin, the user uploads an XLIFF file containing translations. The plugin analyzes the file, determines the source language, and lists available target languages.


The user then selects which languages to translate the frame into. To begin the translation, simply select a frame in Figma that contains text elements.


Once the "Create copy" button is pressed, the plugin automatically scans all the text within the frame and creates copies of the frame for each selected target language, effectively localizing your design with just a few click.
plugins.tagline: K Translation: localize Figma frames into multiple languages using XLIFF files in just a few clicks.

103740.name: K Translation
103740.description:
K Translation is a localization tool designed to simplify the process of translating your Figma frames into multiple languages using XLIFF files.


After installing the plugin, the user uploads an XLIFF file containing translations. The plugin analyzes the file, determines the source language, and lists available target languages.


The user then selects which languages to translate the frame into. To begin the translation, simply select a frame in Figma that contains text elements.


Once the "Create copy" button is pressed, the plugin automatically scans all the text within the frame and creates copies of the frame for each selected target language, effectively localizing your design with just a few click.
103740.release_notes: Added the ability to download a file containing texts that were not translated.
103740.tagline: K Translation: localize Figma frames into multiple languages using XLIFF files in just a few clicks.

plugins.name: Dimensões - by Ultra Solutions
plugins.description:
Sabe aquela dor de começar um projeto do zero, configurando manualmente cada tamanho de arte e cada grid?


Nosso plugin elimina esse retrabalho: em um clique você gera quadros prontos para social media, landing pages, projetos behance, área de membros, etc — todos posicionados lado a lado e com layouts precisos. Chega de formatos perdidos, dimensionamento errado e ter que ficar perguntando em grupo ou buscando em trabalhos passados.


Com o “Dimensões – by Ultra Solutions”, seu tempo será gasto apenas criando o design, e não ajustando tamanho por tamanho.


Acompanhe nosso site oficial e nossas redes, fique por dentro de mais novidades!

Clique aqui para acessar nosso site oficial!
plugins.tagline: Chega de perguntar qual tamanho da imagem da área de membros de tal plataforma, etc.

plugins.name: Description Generator - AI Powered 🚀
plugins.description:
Boost your design documentation effortlessly!


This plugin scans your Figma file and auto-generates descriptions for Components, Component Sets and Variants either using smart rule-based logic or your preferred AI provider (ChatGPT, Gemini, Claude, Mistral, Cohere, OpenRouter, Grok).


Choose your method, enter your API key (for AI) and get consistent, scalable, and meaningful descriptions right where they belong.


✅ Rule-based generation

🤖 AI-powered description (via API Key)

🧠 Supports Components, Sets & Variants

🌍 Supports 11 languages (🇬🇧 English, 🇹🇷 Türkçe, 🇩🇪 Deutsch, 🇫🇷 Français, 🇪🇸 Español, 🇮🇹 Italiano, 🇵🇹 Português, 🇷🇺 Русский, 🇯🇵 日本語, 🇰🇷 한국어, 🇨🇳 中文)

🧩 Designed for structured design systems
plugins.tagline: Auto generate component descriptions with rules or AI ✨

plugins.name: Syncalise
plugins.description:
Because life is too short to manually copy translations, Syncalise beams the words from Lokalise straight into your Figma designs. ✨


Syncalise is a Figma plugin that:

  1. Talks to Lokalise via their API 🤝
  2. Lists all your translation keys & languages 🗝️
  3. Lets you slap any translation onto a selected text layer in a single click 🖱️
  4. Helps you annotate & export strings without the usual tears 💧


All that, wrapped in a tiny React app living comfortably inside Figma.


90-second quick start ⏱️

  1. Grab the plugin from Figma Community or clone this repo and build locally (see dev setup below).
  2. Open the plugin inside Figma → you'll land on Settings.
  3. Paste your Lokalise API token and hit Save. (We never send it anywhere except Lokalise – pinky promise.)
  4. Pick a project from the dropdown.
  5. Head over to the Keys tab, select your language, search a key and click it while a Figma text layer is selected.
  6. 💥 Boom – translated! Time to grab a coffee ☕.
plugins.tagline: The "Why-am-I-still-copy-pasting-strings?" Figma plugin

137558.name: Syncalise
137558.description:
Because life is too short to manually copy translations, Syncalise beams the words from Lokalise straight into your Figma designs. ✨


Syncalise is a Figma plugin that:

  1. Talks to Lokalise via their API 🤝
  2. Lists all your translation keys & languages 🗝️
  3. Lets you slap any translation onto a selected text layer in a single click 🖱️
  4. Helps you annotate & export strings without the usual tears 💧


All that, wrapped in a tiny React app living comfortably inside Figma.


90-second quick start ⏱️

  1. Grab the plugin from Figma Community or clone this repo and build locally (see dev setup below).
  2. Open the plugin inside Figma → you'll land on Settings.
  3. Paste your Lokalise API token and hit Save. (We never send it anywhere except Lokalise – pinky promise.)
  4. Pick a project from the dropdown.
  5. Head over to the Keys tab, select your language, search a key and click it while a Figma text layer is selected.
  6. 💥 Boom – translated! Time to grab a coffee ☕.

networkAccess.reasoning: Syncalise needs to access the Lokalise API to fetch projects and translations.

plugins.name: Bulk Text Replacer
plugins.description:
CSV形式のファイルを読み込んで一括置換できます。

1列目に検索対象、2列目に置換内容を記述したCSVファイルを読み込ませて使用して下さい。


手入力で「検索する言葉」と「置換する言葉」の間に「=>」を入れることでも可能です。

例：検索する言葉 => 置換する言葉


You can perform bulk text replacement by importing a CSV file.

The first column should contain the text to search for, and the second column should contain the replacement text.


Alternatively, you can manually enter replacement pairs using the => format.

Example: original text => replacement text
plugins.tagline: Bulk text replacement for Figma, Figjam & Slides.

137797.name: Bulk Text Replacer
137797.description:

例：検索する言葉 => 置換する言葉


You can perform bulk text replacement by importing a CSV file.

The first column should contain the text to search for, and the second column should contain the replacement text.


Alternatively, you can manually enter replacement pairs using the => format.

Example: original text => replacement text
137797.release_notes:
検出されなかったテキストを一覧表示し、CSV形式で書き出せるようにしました。
Unmatched texts can now be viewed in a list and exported as a CSV file.
137797.tagline: Bulk text replacement for Figma, Figjam & Slides.

plugins.name: Color Variable Binder
plugins.description:
1. Suitable for copying layer fill, stroke variables, and color style with the same name replacement.

2. Suitable for replacing the same named solid color variable for copying layer effects.

3. The copied color style is internally bound to the same named solid color and gradient color variables, as well as the color variables within the gradient color.

plugins.name: Component State Mapper
plugins.description:
Tired of getting lost in complex component variants? Struggling to track every possible state, prevent design inconsistencies, and explain component logic to your team?


Introducing State Mapper, the essential Figma plugin that transforms your complex component sets into clear, interactive, and easy-to-understand visual maps. Stop navigating your variants blindfolded and gain a bird's-eye view of your entire component architecture.


With a single click, State Mapper instantly generates a live flowchart of all your variants, showing you exactly how they connect and what properties change between them.


Key Features:


  2. 🗺️ Instant Visual Mapping: Automatically generate beautiful, easy-to-read diagrams from any component set. See the full picture, from simple buttons to complex data tables.
  3. 🔬 Powerful Filtering & Layouts: Is your map too complex? No problem. Isolate exactly what you need by filtering properties and values. Switch between Hierarchical, Graph, and Matrix layouts to find the perfect view.
  4. ⚠️ Smart "Missing State" Detection: Our most powerful feature! State Mapper intelligently analyzes your component's properties and automatically flags potential "holes" or missing variants in your system, helping you prevent bugs before they happen.
  5. 🤝 Seamless Handoff & Documentation: Export your component maps as SVG or PNG to include them directly in your documentation on Confluence, Notion, or Jira. Make sure developers understand the logic perfectly.
  6. 🔄 Live Sync: Keep your map updated in real-time. As you add, remove, or change variants, your map reflects those changes instantly.

Who is it for?


State Mapper is built for meticulous Product Designers, UI/UX Designers, and Design System teams who want to build more robust, error-free, and well-documented components.


Install State Mapper today and bring order, clarity, and intelligence to your design system!
plugins.tagline: Bring clarity to component chaos.

plugins.name: Simple Ruler
plugins.description:
📐 四辺定規システム

  1. パネルの上下左右すべての辺に精密な目盛りを表示
  2. ピクセル単位での正確な測定が可能


🔍 自動ズーム対応

  1. Figmaのズーム率変化をリアルタイム検知
  2. ズーム率に応じて目盛り間隔を自動調整
  3. 常に実際のピクセル値を正確に表示
  4. ズーム率表示の場合は、クリックすることでデザインデータを等倍に


📏 リサイズ機能

  1. 8方向のリサイズハンドル（四隅 + 各辺中央）
  2. ドラッグ操作で自由にサイズ変更可能
  3. リサイズ中も目盛りがリアルタイム更新
  4. 邪魔にならないように、折りたたんで端に寄せることが可能（最小化／展開）


📊 情報表示パネル

  1. 現在のサイズを「幅 XXXpx × 高さ XXXpx」形式で表示
  2. ズーム率を「実寸大」「ズーム率 XXX%」形式で表示
plugins.tagline: プラグインウインドウでデザインデータ内のオブジェクトのサイズを直感的に計測できます。

Design smarter with Fake Products Library, the ultimate Figma plugin packed with hundreds of realistic fake product cards – complete with 📦 title, 📝 description, 💲 price, 🖼️ CTOCL image, and 🗂️ category.


🚀 Perfect for:


🛍️ E-commerce mockups


📱 App UI prototypes


💼 Client presentations


🎓 Design portfolios & case studies


Simply drag & drop any fake product into your design – no more wasting time hunting for placeholder content!


✅ Save time

✅ Impress clients

✅ Create pixel-perfect product layouts in seconds


🔧 Made for Designers. Built for Speed.

Try Fake Products Library today and bring your ideas to life – faster, cleaner, and better!

plugins.name: Figma to Amplitude Taxonomy Exporter
plugins.description:
If your team hands off the tracking plan along with the design in figma and then manually creates the tracking plan inside amplitude again, use this plugin to export the tracking plan inside figma and import it to amplitude.


Just write your event and event properties in the syntax shown in the instructions, select all events you want to export, run the plugin and get the csv.
plugins.tagline: Send tracking plan from Figma to Amplitude in two clicks

plugins.name: Awesome Bulk Metadata Importer
plugins.description:
Have you ever tried to add extra documentation to your Figma components, looking or better parity with your code or docs site? With this plugin, you can better utilize the Assets menu by searching components or icons by description or keywords.


This plugin checks a JSON file, and updates the alt text/description, synonym keywords, and link for all components and variants. Run this 1x for your entire library and stop wasting time manually updating metadata!


Sample CSV and JSON template
plugins.tagline: Bulk update your component descriptions, keywords, and docs link

137250.description:
Have you ever tried to add extra documentation to your Figma components, looking or better parity with your code or docs site? With this plugin, you can better utilize the Assets menu by searching components or icons by description or keywords.


This plugin checks a JSON file, and updates the alt text/description, synonym keywords, and link for all components and variants. Run this 1x for your entire library and stop wasting time manually updating metadata!

plugins.name: Content Magic Filler with OpenAI
plugins.description:
1. Select one or more layers in your Figma file (the plugin will find all text layers within your selection).
  2. Open the plugin and enter your OpenAI API key. If you don't have one: https://help.openai.com/en/articles/4936850-where-do-i-find-my-openai-api-key
  3. Type a prompt or instruction describing the kind of text you want (e.g., “US zip code”, “company name”, “city in Japan”).
  4. Click "Generate Text". Each selected text layer will be filled with a unique, AI-generated response matching your instruction.
plugins.tagline: Instantly fill your Figma text layers with smart, unique AI-generated content.

135957.name: Content Magic Filler with OpenAI
135957.description:
1. Select one or more layers in your Figma file (the plugin will find all text layers within your selection).
  2. Open the plugin and enter your OpenAI API key. If you don't have one: https://help.openai.com/en/articles/4936850-where-do-i-find-my-openai-api-key
  3. Type a prompt or instruction describing the kind of text you want (e.g., “US zip code”, “company name”, “city in Japan”).
  4. Click "Generate Text". Each selected text layer will be filled with a unique, AI-generated response matching your instruction.

networkAccess.reasoning: This plugin needs to communicate with OpenAI's API to generate AI-powered text content for selected layers in Figma.

135957.tagline: Instantly fill your Figma text layers with smart, unique AI-generated content.

plugins.name: JSON Frame Mapper
plugins.description:
# JSON Frame Mapper: Figma Plugin


## Main use case


You have a number of items with data in a collection as a single source of truth.


You also have a Figma design which you would like to use as a template.


You would like to create as many items as you have in your collection, with the data from each item using your Figma design as a template.


Wouldn't it be useful to map the data to the template, press a button and - BAM! - loads of content based on the template with the data from your collection?


I think so.


---


This plugin is completely free so feel free to not buy me a [coffee](https://buymeacoffee.com/shragor)


Although... if you did, you could leave a message asking for functional upgrades which I would consider 🤔


---


## How the thing works


1. Install the plugin in Figma (you should know how to do this)

2. Pick the frame you want to use as a template

3. Alter the fieldNames you want populated with your JSON data - note, change the name of the field, not the value - by surrounding them like {{this}}

4. Open the plugin (you can do this at any time tbh)

5. Click "Load JSON File" to load your JSON file (check next section for the required format)

6. If your frame is not selected, select it by clicking its name

7. JSON Frame Mapper will attempt to map {{fieldNames}} to Fields

8. You can manually change the mapping of fieldNames to JSON fields if you want to

9. Set "Generation Settings". Frames are generated from left to right starting from the right of the template (so make sure you have room!)

10. Frame separation sets the number of pixels between generated frames

11. Max horizontal frames sets the maximum number of frames generated to the right before it moves to a new line below the first generated frames

12. The "Generate Frames" button is there but I don't remember why. Give it a shot and see if anything happens


---


## The data


Currently the **JSON Frame Mapper** accepts only a JSON in this form:


```

[

{

"name": [Item 1's name/title],

"field1": [VALUE],

"field2": [VALUE],

...

},

{

"name": [Item 2's name/title],

"field1": [VALUE],

"field2": [VALUE],

...

},

...

]

```


So, an array of objects with key/value pairs or fields of whatever you want to call them.


In my use case, the keys correspond to column headings in a spreadsheet I output to JSON. Each row beneath the column headings is a single item I want to use with the template.


---


## Other stuff


- The plugin will look for a JSON field of "name", "Name", "title" or "Title" and use it as the name for the generated frame

- On successfully loading a JSON, it will display the number of items and fields such as ```25 items with 23 fields loaded```

- It looks for {{fieldNames}} whenever a frame is selected so you can deselect or select another frame/template after the JSON is loaded

- You can't load another or different JSON once you have loaded the first one. Unfortunately, the only way you can change JSON once loaded is:

1. Closing the Plugin

2. Exiting Figma

3. Uninstalling Figma

4. Uninstalling Windows or if Mac, upgrade your Mac to the latest silicon

5. Reinstalling Windows or opening your new Mac

6. Installing Figma

7. Installing JSON Frame Mapper Plugin

8. Opening the Plugin

- Note: only steps 1 and 8 are required for most people to clear the JSON file


## Similar plugins I tried and didn't like


- JSON -> content

- Google Sheets Sync

- Google Sheets → Figma

- Data Lab

- Google Sheets Sync

- Data Populator

- others I can't remember


## Language clarification


You *probably* don't need to read this.


*Frame* = A Figma frame, you should know what this is. It will contain your Template


*Template* = A frame where you have all the design done and text fields in place but need lots of versions of each with different text (which is in your JSON file)


*fieldNames* = The name for a field/text field etc. in your Figma Frame/Template. Some of these will contain the text you want lots of different versions of


*Item* = An individual thing in your JSON file which contains many Fields each with the data you want to map to your fieldNames and add to your Template


*Fields* = These are the names/titles/keys of the data in your JSON. Each Item will have one or more of these and each Field can be mapped to none, one or many fieldNames in the Template


*Value* = The actual value for a given Field of a given Item in your JSON. Hopefully, this will eventually appear in a Template if everything goes well


*Map* = Linking of a fieldName to a Field
plugins.tagline: Create new instances of a frame/template from JSON data

137181.name: JSON Frame Mapper
137181.description:
# JSON Frame Mapper: Figma Plugin


## Main use case


You have a number of items with data in a collection as a single source of truth.


You also have a Figma design which you would like to use as a template.


You would like to create as many items as you have in your collection, with the data from each item using your Figma design as a template.


Wouldn't it be useful to map the data to the template, press a button and - BAM! - loads of content based on the template with the data from your collection?


I think so.


---


This plugin is completely free so feel free to not buy me a [coffee](https://buymeacoffee.com/shragor)


Although... if you did, you could leave a message asking for functional upgrades which I would consider 🤔


---


## How the thing works


1. Install the plugin in Figma (you should know how to do this)

2. Pick the frame you want to use as a template

3. Alter the fieldNames you want populated with your JSON data - note, change the name of the field, not the value - by surrounding them like {{this}}

4. Open the plugin (you can do this at any time tbh)

5. Click "Load JSON File" to load your JSON file (check next section for the required format)

6. If your frame is not selected, select it by clicking its name

7. JSON Frame Mapper will attempt to map {{fieldNames}} to Fields

8. You can manually change the mapping of fieldNames to JSON fields if you want to

9. Set "Generation Settings". Frames are generated from left to right starting from the right of the template (so make sure you have room!)

10. Frame separation sets the number of pixels between generated frames

11. Max horizontal frames sets the maximum number of frames generated to the right before it moves to a new line below the first generated frames

12. The "Generate Frames" button is there but I don't remember why. Give it a shot and see if anything happens


---


## The data


Currently the **JSON Frame Mapper** accepts only a JSON in this form:


```

[

{

"name": [Item 1's name/title],

"field1": [VALUE],

"field2": [VALUE],

...

},

{

"name": [Item 2's name/title],

"field1": [VALUE],

"field2": [VALUE],

...

},

...

]

```


So, an array of objects with key/value pairs or fields of whatever you want to call them.


In my use case, the keys correspond to column headings in a spreadsheet I output to JSON. Each row beneath the column headings is a single item I want to use with the template.


---


## Other stuff


- The plugin will look for a JSON field of "name", "Name", "title" or "Title" and use it as the name for the generated frame

- On successfully loading a JSON, it will display the number of items and fields such as ```25 items with 23 fields loaded```

- It looks for {{fieldNames}} whenever a frame is selected so you can deselect or select another frame/template after the JSON is loaded

- You can't load another or different JSON once you have loaded the first one. Unfortunately, the only way you can change JSON once loaded is:

1. Closing the Plugin

2. Exiting Figma

3. Uninstalling Figma

4. Uninstalling Windows or if Mac, upgrade your Mac to the latest silicon

5. Reinstalling Windows or opening your new Mac

6. Installing Figma

7. Installing JSON Frame Mapper Plugin

8. Opening the Plugin

- Note: only steps 1 and 8 are required for most people to clear the JSON file


## Similar plugins I tried and didn't like


- JSON -> content

- Google Sheets Sync

- Google Sheets → Figma

- Data Lab

- Google Sheets Sync

- Data Populator

- others I can't remember


## Language clarification


You *probably* don't need to read this.


*Frame* = A Figma frame, you should know what this is. It will contain your Template


*Template* = A frame where you have all the design done and text fields in place but need lots of versions of each with different text (which is in your JSON file)


*fieldNames* = The name for a field/text field etc. in your Figma Frame/Template. Some of these will contain the text you want lots of different versions of


*Item* = An individual thing in your JSON file which contains many Fields each with the data you want to map to your fieldNames and add to your Template


*Fields* = These are the names/titles/keys of the data in your JSON. Each Item will have one or more of these and each Field can be mapped to none, one or many fieldNames in the Template


*Value* = The actual value for a given Field of a given Item in your JSON. Hopefully, this will eventually appear in a Template if everything goes well


*Map* = Linking of a fieldName to a Field

networkAccess.reasoning: This plugin allows users to load images and data from their local development servers. Users often run local servers on common ports (3000, 4000, 5000, 8000, 8080, 9000) to serve images, SVG files, and JSON data that they want to import into their Figma designs. Localhost access enables seamless integration with local development workflows and self-hosted content.

137181.release_notes:
Now accepts and imports SVGs.

If an object {{field}} (a rectangle or square, say) is mapped to a SVG, the object will be replaced by a frame containing a group of the SVG. The SVG will be exactly the same size, shape and location (in the design) as the parent {{field}}
137181.tagline: Create new instances of a frame/template from JSON data

plugins.name: Color Explorer
plugins.description:
🎨 What is Color Explorer?

Color Explorer is a smart Figma plugin designed to help designers, early-stage founders, agencies, strategists, DTC operators, and marketers quickly find the perfect color palettes for their brand.


With over 3,000+ curated palettes (increasing everyday), you can preview and apply full-brand color systems to any selected frame or layer—in one click.


🚀 Key Features

  1. Alpha-Safe Mapping: Automatically preserves transparency values (alpha channel)
  2. 3000+ Color Palettes: Handpicked and categorized palettes to match different brand moods and industries
  3. One-Click Apply: Instantly replace all fill/stroke/text colors in your selection
  4. Lightweight and Fast: Designed for speed and real-time creative flow


🔧 Use Cases

  1. Explore visual directions before committing to a brand look
  2. Save time in early-stage design sprints
  3. Quickly swap palettes in Figma without manual editing
  4. Present polished options to clients and stakeholders


💸 One-Time Purchase

Get lifetime access for a one-time fee of $10. No subscription. Free updates forever.
plugins.tagline: One Click to Try 3000+ Color Palettes on Your Design.

plugins.name: Token Architect
plugins.description:
Token Architect is a comprehensive design token management solution that bridges the gap between Figma and your development workflow. Create, export, and import design tokens with intelligent automation and bidirectional sync capabilities.


KEY FEATURES:

  1. Generate Complete Token Systems - Create comprehensive design tokens from a single brand colour with automatic shade generation
  2. Smart Color Palette Generation - Transform any colour into professional 100-900 shade scales with HSL-based algorithms
  3. Export Figma Variables - Convert your Figma variables into industry-standard JSON tokens
  4. Import External Tokens - Bring design tokens from popular tools (Style Dictionary, Design Tokens W3C) into Figma
  5. Advanced Token Classification - Automatic organisation into primitives and semantic token hierarchies
  6. Multi-Category Support - Colours, spacing, typography, responsive breakpoints, and semantic tokens
  7. Real-time Preview & Validation - Live JSON output with comprehensive debugging capabilities


PERFECT FOR:

  1. Design system managers building tokens from scratch or maintaining consistency
  2. Frontend developers implementing design tokens in modern frameworks
  3. Teams using tools like Style Dictionary, Tokens Studio, or custom token pipelines
  4. Organisations scaling design systems across products and platforms



Please reach out to ozarg.studio@gmail.com if you have any issues or would like to request a feature. Or let's connect on LinkedIn. Cool ideas welcome :)

accepted.name: OZAR STUDIO
accepted.description: We are a design studio working worldwide . We provide a range of design and development services.

plugins.tagline: Export and Import your variables in a developer-friendy way

Image generator designed for professionals, built on ComfyUI

  2. Connect with Figma to easily automate your creative work.
  3. Browse, select, and launch the app you want — it's easy to create your own.
139135.release_notes:
- Queue 관련 최적화를 시도 했습니다.
- 300 px일 경우 화면이 잘못 나오는 문제를 수정 했습니다.

plugins.name: Design System Explorer
plugins.description: Analyze and manage external design system components, styles, and variables in your Figma file. Quickly identify which elements come from external libraries, see usage counts, and select all instances with one click.
plugins.tagline: design system, library, components, styles, variables, external, inspector, migration, organization

plugins.name: Fast Page Selector
plugins.description:
Efficient page selection and navigation when working with files containing many pages.


Features

  1. Page Grouping: Automatically group pages using Divider pages (pages starting with `---` or containing `divider`)
  2. Select by select box: Display each group in select boxes for intuitive page selection
  3. Compact View: Hide/Show functionality to minimize plugin window and efficiently utilize workspace
plugins.tagline: Navigate hundreds of pages in a flash.

134511.name: Fast Page Selector
134511.description:
Efficient page selection and navigation when working with files containing many pages.


Features

  1. Page Grouping: Automatically group pages using Divider pages (pages starting with `---` or containing `divider`)
  2. Select by select box: Display each group in select boxes for intuitive page selection
  3. Compact View: Hide/Show functionality to minimize plugin window and efficiently utilize workspace
134511.release_notes: Fix cannot moving page when selected
134511.tagline: Navigate hundreds of pages in a flash.

plugins.name: Padding Scaler
plugins.description:
Padding Scaler helps designers rapidly create compact, default, and spacious layout variants by scaling the vertical paddings of auto-layout frames.


Instead of editing each value manually, simply select your frames, choose a scale (0.5× to 4×), and instantly apply consistent spacing changes.


Ideal for testing different density modes or aligning with design system spacing tokens.


✨ Features:


Works with one or many auto-layout frames


Choose vertical, horizontal, or both directions


Fast, intuitive UI with live scaling preview


Save time, stay consistent, and iterate layout decisions faster.
plugins.tagline: Instantly scale vertical and/or horizontal paddings in auto-layout frames to test density modes.

134488.name: Padding Scaler
134488.description:
Padding Scaler helps designers rapidly create compact, default, and spacious layout variants by scaling the vertical paddings of auto-layout frames.


Instead of editing each value manually, simply select your frames, choose a scale (0.5× to 4×), and instantly apply consistent spacing changes.


Ideal for testing different density modes or aligning with design system spacing tokens.


✨ Features:


Works with one or many auto-layout frames


Choose vertical, horizontal, or both directions


Fast, intuitive UI with live scaling preview


Save time, stay consistent, and iterate layout decisions faster.
134488.tagline: Instantly scale vertical and/or horizontal paddings in auto-layout frames to test density modes.

plugins.name: World Clock
plugins.description:
Stay in sync with your global team — right inside Figma.

World Clock Plugin lets you add real-time clocks for any city around the world. Just type a city name, select it, and instantly view its current time in a beautifully minimal interface.


Perfect for remote teams, cross-border collabs, and late-night design sprints.
plugins.tagline: Never ask ‘What time is it there?’ again.

134090.name: World Clock
134090.description:
Stay in sync with your global team — right inside Figma.

World Clock Plugin lets you add real-time clocks for any city around the world. Just type a city name, select it, and instantly view its current time in a beautifully minimal interface.


Perfect for remote teams, cross-border collabs, and late-night design sprints.
134090.tagline: Never ask ‘What time is it there?’ again.

plugins.name: Figma Link Exporter
plugins.description:
igmaファイル内のセクション（Section）、コンポーネント（Component）、コンポーネントセット（ComponentSet）、バリアント（Variant）を自動検出し、それぞれの直接リンクを生成するプラグインです。デザインシステムの管理や共有に最適です。

主な機能

  1. 自動検出: Figmaファイル内のセクション、コンポーネント、コンポーネントセット、バリアントを自動で検出
  2. 詳細情報表示: 各要素の番号、種類、名前、直接リンクを一覧表示
  3. 複数形式でエクスポート: 検出した情報をTXT、CSV、JSON形式でダウンロード可能

使用シーン

  1. デザインシステムのドキュメント作成
  2. チーム内でのコンポーネント共有
  3. 開発者へのデザイン仕様の引き渡し
  4. プロジェクト管理のための要素整理

使い方

  1. プラグインを起動
  2. 「情報を取得」ボタンをクリック
  3. 検出された要素の一覧を確認
  4. 希望の形式（TXT/CSV/JSON）を選択してダウンロード
  5. シンプルな操作で、デザインファイル内の重要な要素へのリンクを素早くエクスポートできます。
plugins.tagline: Figmaファイル内のセクション、コンポーネント、バリアントを自動検出し、それらの直接リンクをTXT/CSV/JSON形式でエクスポートできるプラグインです。

plugins.name: QR Generator
plugins.description:
Generate crisp, scannable QR codes directly in Figma—for free. Whether you’re linking to a website, product, or prototype, it’s never been easier to add functional codes to your designs.


Need more than just the basics? Unlock the ability to fully customize your QR codes:

– Adjust colors to match your brand

– Tweak corner and eye styles

– Control padding, sizing, and error correction

– Apply your own design language


Perfect for teams and designers who want their work to look as good as it works.

Use it for client presentations, posters, packaging, or anything else where detail matters.


Free to generate. Paid to make it yours.


You can contact us at support@easestud.io

visit easestud.io
plugins.tagline: Simple QR codes, beautifully yours.
